name: SpriteOptions
description: Options for configuring a Sprite instance. Defines the texture, anchor point, and rendering behavior. ```ts // Create a basic sprite with texture const sprite = new Sprite({ texture: Texture.from('sprite.png') }); // Create a centered sprite with rounded position const centeredSprite = new Sprite({ texture: Texture.from('centered.png'), anchor: 0.5,        // Center point roundPixels: true,  // Crisp rendering x: 100,            // Position from ViewContainerOptions y: 100 }); // Create a sprite with specific anchor points const anchoredSprite = new Sprite({ texture: Texture.from('corner.png'), anchor: { x: 1,  // Right-aligned y: 0   // Top-aligned } }); ```

properties.name: texture
properties.description: The texture to use for the sprite. If not provided, uses Texture.EMPTY ```ts // Create a sprite with a texture const sprite = new Sprite({ texture: Texture.from('path/to/image.png') }); // Update the texture later sprite.texture = Texture.from('path/to/another-image.png'); ```

properties.name: anchor
properties.description: The anchor point of the sprite (0-1 range). Controls the origin point for rotation, scaling, and positioning. Can be a number for uniform anchor or a PointData for separate x/y values. ```ts // Centered anchor anchor: 0.5 // Separate x/y anchor anchor: { x: 0.5, y: 0.5 } // Right-aligned anchor anchor: { x: 1, y: 0 } ```

properties.name: roundPixels
properties.description: Whether or not to round the x/y position to whole pixels. Useful for crisp pixel art style rendering. ```ts const sprite = new Sprite({ texture: Texture.from('sprite.png'), roundPixels: true // Ensures crisp rendering }); ```
